entry.title: Re: How does S/4HANA handle scenarios where the commodity...
entry.content:
In ECC, when the commodity code's unit of measure (UOM) differs from the material's base UOM, the system prompts you to enter a conversion factor during material master maintenance. This ensures correct reporting for Intrastat and foreign trade declarations.

However, in S/4HANA (especially from version 2020 onward), this conversion factor prompt is no longer available directly in the material master. SAP has restructured how commodity codes and UOM conversions are handled, particularly in the context of International Trade and Group Reporting.

In S/4HANA, commodity code maintenance is decoupled from the material master. You now use the Fiori app ‚ÄúManage Commodity Codes‚Äù to Assign commodity codes, maintain UOMs and conversion factors and link them to material groups or product categories.

SAP expects conversion factors to be maintained via external trade data or custom tables, not manually in the material master. You can use custom logic or BAdIs to fetch conversion factors during reporting or declaration.

If you're uploading materials via LTMC or Migration Cockpit, you can include conversion factors in the Commodity Code template. This is the preferred method for initial data load or mass updates.

entry.title: Re: Condition Contract with Quantity Scale - Settlement A...
entry.content:
As of now, SAP S/4HANA does not offer a standard condition type like REBD for quantity-based contracts to manually adjust business volume. However, there are workarounds and enhancement options you can explore:

You can create a custom condition type (similar to REBD but for quantity) and configure it to post delta quantities. This requires defining a new condition type in Settlement Management and enhancing the settlement logic to consider this delta quantity during scale determination.

SAP allows manual business volume uploads via transaction WB2R_BUSVOL or through Fiori apps. You can upload missing quantities manually using Material, Customer, Contract reference, Quantity and UoM. This is especially useful when billing documents fail to post correctly or are missing due to master data issues.

You can implement this BAdI BADI_BUSINESS_VOLUME to inject additional business volume during the settlement process. This is the most flexible option and allows you to pull data from external sources, add missing quantities dynamically and ensure correct scale level is picked

entry.title: Outbound Transportation from MFG site having EWM,StRM, Lean Warehouse under one Freight Order to DC
entry.content:
Many Industries consider the manufacturing location as a plant in SAP. Under the plant, many storage locations would be available in SAP and some of them would be either IM managed (or Lean Warehouse managed), or Stock Room Managed (StRM) or EWM managed. As a part of the distribution process from the manufacturing site, there would be every chance that the different products from all these types of warehouses need to be shipped to other DC site or to the customer.

This blog covers my personal insights about the outbound process in SAP from MFG (manufacturing) site to other DC (distribution center) or to the customer wherein the different products are picked up from Lean Warehouse, StRM and EWM managed warehouse locations and loaded onto the the same vehicle under the single Freight Order (FO) with the help of SAP EWM and SAP TM ASR integration in basic S/4 HANA licence or in advanced S/4 HANA license using S/4 HANA 2023 FPS02 version. 

Process FLow - 

Process Flow - MFG Site (that has LE, StRM and EWM warehouse) to another DC / Customer in single Freight Order

Master Data -

  1. Maintain Loading Point location for EWM specific warehouse - transaction code # /SCMTMS/LOC3 -

Loading Point - EWM Warehouse

 2. Maintain Loading Point location for StRM specific warehouse - transaction code # /SCMTMS/LOC3 -

Loading Point - StRM Warehouse

3. Maintain Loading Point location for LE specific warehouse - transaction code # /SCMTMS/LOC3 -

Loading Point - LE Warehouse

4. Assign EWM Door in EWM Warehouse to the Loading Point - transaction code # /SCWM/DOOR_SCU -

Assign EWM Door to Loading Point

5. Assign StRM and LE Warehouse specific Door to the Loading Point - transaction code # /SCMTMS/M_ASRDOOR -

Assign StRM and LE Door to Loading Point

Documents in S/4 HANA -

1. Create multiple STO's from MFG plant to another DC.

2. Create multiple OBD's - 

EWM Relevant Delivery

Next -

StRM Relevant Delivery

Next -

Lean WH Relevant Delivery

3. Freight Unit (FU) gets created automatically and is further planned with the help of transportation cockpit automatically / manually and Freight Order (FO) is created and carrier is assigned based on the existing freight agreement arrangements.

Planning of Multiple Freight Units that have warehouse specific Loading Points

4. Perform each warehouse specific steps - picking, packing and staging.

5. Perform Arrival at the Door, Loading, Departure from the Door and PGI at Loading Point of LE Warehouse  - Fiori App - Load/Unload Freight Order.

Update in FO Execution Status after shipping steps in LE Warehouse

6. Perform Arrival at the Door, Loading, Departure from the Door and PGI at Loading Point of StRM Warehouse  - Fiori App - Load/Unload Freight Order.

FO Execution after Shipping steps in StRM Warehouse

7.Perform Arrival at the Door, Loading, Departure from the Door and PGI at Loading Point of EWMM Warehouse - Fiori App - Load/Unload Freight Order.

FO Status Overview at EWM Loading Point

Next -

FO Execution after Shipping steps in EWM Warehouse

Please share your comment and/or feedback in case of any suggestions.
Happy Reading !!!
Thanks
Prashant

Note -  The concept of usage of "Consignment Order" in ASR during the outbound process shipment for multiple customers will be covered in next blog.
Please follow topic to know more about SAP Extended Warehouse Management.
Please post and answer questions at here
Please read other posts on the topic at here

entry.title: Data transfer from multiple models to one common model in SAC Planning
entry.content:
Hi Expert,

We‚Äôve created four separate models in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC). At the story level, we‚Äôve blended these models using common dimensions aligned with a primary model.

However, when we attempt to perform calculations involving measures from multiple models, SAC throws errors ‚Äî even when using functions like resultlookup

As a workaround, we‚Äôd like to consolidate data from all four models into a single common model. This would allow us to calcualtions

Model A -- Emp No,Status,srvdate,company code,FRSPla,FRS Rate hrlyrate,salary etc....
ModelB--  BenefitRate,FRS Plan,FRS Rate
MoodelC--Company code, FiscalYear, YrsSRVfrom,YsrSRV TO
ModelD- EmpNo,Leave Type,Fiscal year,leave type ,leave yeast, Blc hrs 
ModelE- Empno,Leavetype.fyYear,leave type leave yr

Primary model has more dimensions which is not in othe models,

Can anyone advise on the best approach to achieve this?

entry.title: Re: Fundamentals clean core
entry.content:
Hi @Mahmoud__Zeidan 

To ensure you have a clean core from scratch in your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition system, here are the programs, tools, and approaches you should use:

  1. SAP Activate Methodology & Best Practices
  • Start your project with SAP Activate and leverage SAP Best Practices scope items for industry-standard business processes and test scripts.
  • Only activate the minimum necessary scope items to avoid unused features and data
  1. SAP Central Business Configuration
  • Use SAP Central Business Configuration for end-to-end configuration, controlling what business functions you use, and keeping tight control over your solution footprint.
  • Carefully define your organizational structure and master data for example plants, sales organisations and company codes to avoid unnecessary complexity.
  1. Standard Tools and Transactions for Core Maintenance
  • SPRO: Only make necessary customizations via SAP standard configuration and not custom code whenever possible.
  • SU01/SU10: User and role management, use template users as suggested in the starter guide.
  • Fiori Rapid Activation: Rapidly activate only needed apps and services.
  1. Custom Development Practices
  • Follow keep the core clean principles
  • Use in-app extensibility Fiori app Custom Fields and Logic for minor adaptations.
  • Use SAP Business Technology Platform side-by-side extensions for more complex enhancements. Avoid custom ABAP in the core when possible.
  • Document all custom developments and ensure they use released APIs and extension points.
  1. Monitoring and Housekeeping
  • Regularly review transaction codes, custom objects, and roles to remove obsolete items.
  • Use SAP Focused Run or ALM tools to monitor system health and integrations.
  • Perform regular security, data privacy, and authorization audits via security transactions and Fiori launchpad tools.
  1. Data & Integration Clean-up
  • Only interface or integrate with essential systems using SAP standard integration methods (e.g., OData services, SAP Cloud Connector).
  • Ensure all master and transactional data migrated is validated, deduplicated, and relevant.

 

I hope this provides the necessary details. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

Implementing SAP S/4HANA Service

Starter system for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition: Getting Started Guide

entry.title: Re: Issue with Subsequent Delivery Free of Charge in Adva...
entry.content:
Hello @aravindrawat 

The error Copying Requirement 304 that you are experiencing occurs because the Reason for Rejection is not set on the return item in the sales order. Unlike the on-premise system, where you can manually change this field (using transaction codes like VOV7/VFBS), SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition manages this automatically.

Explanation:

In the S4 Public Cloud, the system automatically determines the Reason for Rejection based on the follow-up activity chosen during the returns process.
For example, when you select Subsequent Delivery Free of Charge (activity 0002) as the follow-up, the system assigns the relevant rejection reason, marking the item as not billing relevant.
If the rejection reason is missing or not properly assigned, the SD processing step fails with the requirement 304 error.

Next Steps:

  • Please review and update the configuration under SSCUI 105513 ‚Äì Define Logistical Follow-Up Activities.
  • Make sure a valid Reason for Rejection is assigned to follow-up activity 0002 Subsequent Delivery Free of Charge
  • Once set up correctly, the system will update this field automatically during processing, enabling the SD step to proceed smoothly.

Additional Notes:

  • This mechanism aligns with the standard process model in S/4HANA Cloud and eliminates the need for manual rejection reason entry in sales documents.
  • Direct manual modifications to this field in the sales order are not supported in the cloud edition.

For further details, you can refer to:

  • Logistical Follow-Up Activities - SAP Help Portal

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Cost Center Splitting Weights Integrated Financial Pl...
entry.content:
Hello @SANA11 

Based on the details provided, here are the Root Cause to the issue you are facing:

  • The % Splitting Weight you see is derived from a calculated measure based on a restricted measure
  • When you add or edit the restricted measure in the story, even without changing parameters SAC re-evaluates the calculation context.
  • The recalculation changes depending on:
  1. Versioning context for example Plan vs. Actual
  2. Filters or dimension hierarchies in the story vs. model
  3. Whether ‚ÄúEnable Constant Selection‚Äù is checked or unchecked in the calculation editor.

This is why you see the percentage changing when you edit or add the measure. The context shifts and SAC recomputes the formula.

 

Here is how i suggest fixing It

Step 1: Check Calculation Context

In the Calculation Editor:

  1. Go to Measures ‚Üí Subtotal Driver 2.
  2. Ensure constant selection is enabled for Version (you seem to already have this, so it is good).
  3. Do the same for Splitting Weight if required.
  4. Save and recheck the story.

 

Step 2: Validate the Restricted Measure

  • Make sure Subtotal Driver 2 has the same restrictions in the story as in the model:
    • Go to Model ‚Üí Measures ‚Üí Subtotal Driver
    • Compare restrictions for example Cost Center Activity Type, Version and Driver Source.
    • If the story level measure uses different filters, SAC recalculates.

 

Step 3: Lock the Version

  • If your calculation should always be based on the Plan version:
  1. In the Calculation Editor, explicitly select Version = Plan.
  2. Confirm Enable Constant Selection is enabled so other story filters do not override it.

 

Step 4: Compare Story vs. Model Behaviour

  • If the model shows 50% but the story shows a different % after editing, it means
    • Your story filters or dimension drilldowns are overriding model restrictions.
    • To stabilize values, replicate the model calculation context exactly in the story.

SAP suggested best practice: Always manage restricted measures in the model, not in the story, when using standard content, otherwise SAC treats it as a new calculation.

I hope this provides the necessary details. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Query on Advanced Return Management for Service and N...
entry.content:
Hello @aravindrawat 

The error ‚ÄúInvalid Movement Type 657‚Äù occurs because ARM is designed for stock-relevant processes materials:

  • Movement Type 657 is used for returns-to-stock in ARM.
  • Service items (TATX) and NLAG (non-stock, e.g. KLN) do not involve inventory postings.
  • When ARM tries to post a goods movement, there is no stock, so the process fails.

In response to your question: It is not possible to use Advanced Returns Management for Service or NLAG items.

Possible Workaround:

  • Process these returns using a standard return order (without ARM), referring to the original invoice.
  • Exclude ARM flows such as automatic delivery or credit memo.

SAP Knowledge Base Article on Movement Type 657 in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 

This is standard system behaviour in S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition and not a configuration error.

With best regards

Chuma
